title: Can Iran, Israel and the U.S. Now All Claim to Have Won?
summary: Iran’s response to the attacks on its nuclear facilities killed no Americans and each nation has a victory narrative. But an hours-old cease-fire appeared fragile and President Trump lashed out at Israel and Iran over the state of the truce.

title: Uncertain Peace
summary: We explain the state of the cease-fire.

title: A Fragile Cease-Fire Between Iran and Israel, and Toxic Homes in L.A.
summary: Plus, Florida’s new “Alligator Alcatraz” for migrants.

title: Behind Closed Doors, Harvard Officials Debate a Risky Truce With Trump
summary: The university is trying to avoid the appearance of appeasement, something other powerful institutions that made deals with President Trump found impossible.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Proclamation Barring Harvard’s International Students
summary: The same judge issued an order last week blocking a separate government effort to keep the school from enrolling students from abroad.

title: Judge’s Ruling Casts Doubt on Trump Administration’s Claims Against Migrant
summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi has disregarded departmental norms to level lurid public accusations at Mr. Abrego Garcia without first detailing evidence.

title: Trump Administration to End Protections for 58 Million Acres of National Forests
summary: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said the Clinton-era rule barring road construction and logging was outdated and “absurd.”

title: Here’s How the N.Y.C. Mayoral Results May Emerge
summary: A winner on Tuesday night is unlikely, but not impossible. Ranked-choice voting will play a big role in the outcome. Here’s what else you should look for as votes are counted.

title: Cuomo and Mamdani Push to Raise Turnout in ‘Jump Ball’ Mayor’s Race
summary: A new poll shows the New York City mayor’s race tightening in its final days. Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani are scrambling for every last vote.

title: Trump Asks NATO to Spend More but Is Quiet About Why
summary: The “why” is Russia. But at a summit focused on keeping President Trump happy, discussion of that is expected to be muted.

title: What to Watch for at the NATO Summit
summary: An internal rift over defense spending and President Trump’s disregard for Ukraine have lowered expectations for the gathering.

title: Scenes From the Hottest Blocks in New York City
summary: Whatever the temperature is in Central Park, it’s hotter alongside Newtown Creek, the toxic and industrial waterway separating Brooklyn from Queens.

title: 7 Tips for Managing Extreme Heat
summary: Essential advice to get you through a heat wave.

title: A Trove Of Princess Diana’s Personal Belongings Is Going Up For Auction
summary: A large trove of the princess’ belongings including her Lady Dior handbag, will be auctioned this week. For some buyers, more intimate items are the main draw.

title: Trump’s Iran Diplomacy Failed. I Hope His Airstrike Succeeds.
summary: Iran can’t be allowed to develop a nuclear weapon, but the president’s approach wasn’t the best way to prevent that.

summary: It may be time to rethink the tragic events in Washington and Boulder.

summary: The “Tonight Show” host said it was crazy that the president had “launched an attack on Iran, his own parade and a cellphone in the same week.”

title: Freddie O’Connell Confronts the Limits of Political Power in Nashville
summary: Freddie O’Connell, a policy and transit wonk, is under Republican scrutiny for his response to immigration enforcement in his left-leaning city.

title: In a Big Place With Few People, a Minister Needs a Pilot’s License
summary: The Salvation Army’s “Flying Padres” cross the Australian outback by air, dropping in on ranches and small communities — sometimes, just to lend an ear.

title: Wisconsin Couple Charged in Scheme to Poison Women He Dated
summary: Paul VanDuyne Jr. and Andrea Whitaker placed cyanide, homemade poisons and other substances in water bottles and cars belonging to two women he had briefly dated, the authorities said.

title: Bodies of 3 Hikers Who Jumped in Water Near Lake Tahoe Are Recovered
summary: The three men had been hiking in Soda Springs, Calif., when they jumped into the water near Rattlesnake Falls, a remote and isolated area that made rescue difficult.
